'''Google, Inc.''' {{nasdaq|GOOG}}, is a [[United States|U.S.]]-based corporation, established in [[1998]], that manages the [[Google search]] engine. Google is headquartered at the "[[Googleplex]]" in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]], [[California]], and employs over 1,000 workers. Google's [[CEO]] [[Eric Schmidt|Dr. Eric Schmidt]], formerly CEO of [[Novell]], took over when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down.
+
'''Google, Inc.''' {{nasdaq|GOOG}}, is a [[United States|U.S.]]-based corporation, established in [[1998]], that manages the [[Google search]] engine. Google is headquartered at the "[[Googleplex]]" in [[Mountain View, Santa Clara County, California|Mountain View]], [[California]], and employs over 3,000 workers. Google's [[CEO]] [[Eric Schmidt|Dr. Eric Schmidt]], formerly CEO of [[Novell]], took over when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down.
==History==
==History==
Line 82: Line 82:
===IPO and culture===
===IPO and culture===
â
Many people have suggested that after Google's IPO their culture will not be able to stay so "fun" and focused on the future.[http://www.wired.com/news/business/0,1367,63241,00.html?tw=wn_story_related] [http://www.ciol.com/content/news/2004/104043001.asp] The company may be required to answer to shareholders who will want the company to cut back on employee benefits and to focus on short term advances. Also, it may be hard to maintain a collegial atmosphere when some of the employees are paper-millionaires. In a report given to potential investors, co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page promised that the IPO would not change the company's culture. Later Mr. Page said, "We think a lot about how to maintain our culture and the fun elements."
+
Many people have suggested that after Google's IPO their culture will not be able to stay so "fun" and focused on the future.[http://www.wired.com/news/business/0,1367,63241,00.html?tw=wn_story_related] [http://www.ciol.com/content/news/2004/104043001.asp] The company may be required to answer to shareholders who will want the company to cut back on employee benefits and to focus on short term advances. Also, it may be hard to maintain a collegial atmosphere when approximately 1,000 (30%) of the employees are paper-millionaires. In a report given to potential investors, co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page promised that the IPO would not change the company's culture. Later Mr. Page said, "We think a lot about how to maintain our culture and the fun elements."
==Criticism and controversy==
==Criticism and controversy==
